tool.name: NaaccSnappingPytTool

param.name: naacc_points_table
param.dialogReference: Feature class processed through NAACC Table Ingest tool.

param.name: naacc_points_table_join_field
param.dialogReference: Field in naacc_points_table used to match geometries to geometry_source_table records. Defaults to "Survey_Id".

param.name: geometry_source_table
param.dialogReference: Feature class that includes modified geometries to replace those in naacc_src_table

param.name: geometry_source_table_join_field
param.dialogReference: field in geometry_source_table used to match geometries to naacc_points_table records. Defaults to "Survey_Id".

tool.summary: The NAACC Data Snapping tool can be used to reposition features in a NAACC-compliant feature class to locations in another feature class; e.g., move the NAACC culvert records to point features that have been snapped to streams on a hydrologically corrected DEM.
tool.usage:
The NAACC Data Snapping tool can be used to reposition features in a NAACC-compliant feature class to locations in another feature class; e.g., move the NAACC culvert records to point features that have been snapped to streams on a hydrologically corrected DEM.

Features that are moved are given a flag in a new field, "moved". Features that haven't been moved (due to no matching being found during the join) retain their original location.
